Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms give the restaurant a miss”
Reviews.Author: Paulwoodsie
Reviews.Content: The room here are great but I wish I could say the same about the food good prices but the quality I'd very disappointing dry over cooked fish for dinner dry over cooked eggs for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LeezS2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent location and very helpful staff. Breakfast was very good with great variety. The grounds were really lovely, only downside was the noisy birds in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the proximity of Macquarie Uni/Ryde”
Reviews.Author: Annataf
Reviews.Content: Great location if you have to visit the Macquarie Uni or offices etc in North Ryde. It is often cheaper than Travellodge next to it. Very modern interior, clean and parking is free. It does have a restaurant but I haven't tried the food there. Normally I just walk or drive to the Macquarie shopping center which has a variety of restaurants. Gym is very basic but it does have a treadmill, bicycle and a rowing machine and a multi functional weight trainer. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than it looks from the outside”
Reviews.Author: SydneyRaptor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for graduation of family member. Squeezy for two people - designed for the solo conference goer or visiting academic. It looks like a rubbish blond brick motel but the rooms are way more stylish than that and the food is surprisingly good! The vista is over a lake with water birds and sculpture - misty morning very pleasant and short stroll to the graduation ceremony (done with just the right amount of pomp and modernity). The university has great grounds and most people took good advantage following the ceremony with picnics and walks. A hidden resource only 20mins from city centre by train from the uber modern station at the university.

Reviews.Title: “Close to business park and conference centre”
Reviews.Author: aus_isis
Reviews.Content: Very nice play to stay for a conference. Rooms are smallish but modern and clean. Basic but nice breakfast. Parking available and close to public parking. One of the quitest places i have stayed at in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Clean”
Reviews.Author: TwoSixFiveOh
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet side, this hotel is great for those who want a clean room with free Internet access. Getting into the hotel is pretty tricky and car park is far from the hotel - it can be a problem if you have to walk with boxes and bags. However, there is a place to set down and pick up. The room is furnished ok and the bathroom is clean but is small. There is a nice lounge chair in every room which is great if you want to do some reading. And there's self-service laundry facilites. There's also an in-house restaurant. Easily accessible to Macquarie University.

Reviews.Title: “Room ok, not my idea of 4 star "executive"”
Reviews.Author: Onbusiness255060
Reviews.Content: Service from front desk was average - messy area behind reception with a heap of archive boxes stacked on top of each other - not very "executive" or 4 star. The receptionist did not look very experienced or polished - not the professional image I was expecting. The room was surprsingly clean and modern and the location not too bad. Airconditioning very loud in room. Liked most the modern decor in room Liked least the fact the car park was so far from the foyer (no porter). Had to walk about 400m in the rain and dark to get back after parking. Receptionist said there was a short cut through event centre but was probably locked and if I didnt want to park in car park which was far away I could leave my car on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Full of surprises - Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: FiverACT
Reviews.Content: An interesting place to stay that was full of surprises for our stay. We booked through wotif.com and there was really no indication that the hotel was part of or attached to the Macquarie School of Management, the only real clue would have been the MGSM in the name, but there was no explanation of the name, or it's proximity to the university. This was a surprise, but wasn't particularly a bad thing, we stayed on the weekend and the place was very quite - Did not run into any other guests or students. The room itself was very tasteful - better than we were expecting with fresh looking furnishing and appointments, checkin was friendly and checkout was trouble free. The location was quite good, and close to just about everything you may need. There were just two things we were not overly expecting and probably expected a bit more from. Firstly the room's air conditioner - Loud is an understantement, it sounded like a truck running along the road at full noise, this was apparent to us, perhaps largely related to the 40 degree weather during our stay, the aircon though was very very good, keeping us super cool despite the high outside temp. The gardens and surrounds were very nice too - although check-in and parking made it clear that you were at the university. The second downside was the onsite parking. It was not particularly close to the room, and required a fairly long walk, it was also not particularly secure. On reading this review it might sound a little negative, but that's not my intention. We were pleasantly surprised with the comfort of the room and really enjoyed our stay. We would stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you do not appear 'upperclass'.....”
Reviews.Author: MacStudent2007
Reviews.Content: Beautiful peaceful surroundings overlooking small lake in the sculpture park. Room pretty small and basic, with a 'ledge' off the side which is advertised as a balcony. Staff in the restaurant were not very competent - only about twenty other people in the restaurant, yet I had to wait over an hour for my food because they were 'too busy'. Front desk staff rude and not very helpful in all aspects of dealing with them. Most notably I asked to leave my bags there during the day after I had checked out - after much huffing and puffing, staff member eventually grunted 'ok'. Returned that afternoon to find my bags not locked in the luggage room as requested, but sitting out in the open in the bar area. Excuse was that I had not put them in the luggage room myself and they shouldn't be expected to do it. Not bad considering they'd made the effort to drag my bag (which contained my laptop) out into the bar, right past the luggage room....... Probably great for older people, but if you are young expect to get treated like a second-class citizen.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet. Clean. Handy to Sydney Olympic Park.”
Reviews.Author: fuzzyrhino
Reviews.Content: Very quiet, located off all roads in a conference centre. Handy to the Sydney Olympic Park for sporting & entertainment venues with shuttle buses a 5 minute walk away. Rooms look over parkland with a lake and very relaxing. The restaurant has superb meals. Staff are friendly, obliging and very helpful. Wotif.com arranged the room for us @ AU$105, down from $230. Only drawbacks we found was overnight car parking was a fair walk from the room, though you can unload the car outside the room and there was no pool or spa.

HotelInfo.Name: MGSM Executive Hotel and Conference Centre
HotelInfo.Address: 99 Talavera Road, Sydney, New South Wales 2113, Australia
